intro: Ranunculus kunmingensis, commonly known as the Kunming buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers with five to eight petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are palmately divided and have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and often branched. The flowers bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch of color to its natural habitat.
